page.title: 08PERTON PAST
page.content: During the reign of King William the Domesday Book of 1086 recorded the fact that Perton was called 'Pertone' and measured some three hides being held of Westminster Abbey. The settlement called Pertone was situated in the Seisdon Hundred in South Staffordshire. The name Perton is thought to come from the fact that a long time ago part of the area was covered in orchards. It is because of this that the settlement got the name Pear-Town ot Perton. Today in nearby Tettenhall you can still come across Pear orchards.
